events.text: As Analexius arrived at Gandalf's house on horseback, he couldn't contain his excitement. He had arrived just a little later after Valen.
Bursting through the door, he headed straight for the library where Gandalf was studying.
Gandalf! You won’t believe it! I’m a hero!
Gandalf looked up from his ancient tome, a mixture of curiosity and amusement in his eyes.
A hero, you say? What happened?
I debugged Classoria! The townspeople were praising me, saying I saved them from the bugs and glitches. It was amazing!
At that moment, Valen entered the house again, having overheard the commotion. He nonchalantly listens to the story of Analexius.
Analexius, caught up in his own story, didn't notice Valen's arrival at first. He continued his tale with exaggerated enthusiasm.
I fought off all the bugs and glitches on my own. I was battered and weary, but I stood my ground. They even escorted me here with cheers and praises.
Gandalf chuckled, sensing the embellishment in Analexius's story.
Quite the tale, Analexius. But tell me, how did you manage to get back here alone?
Analexius, relishing in his newfound fame, puffed out his chest.
As thanks for my bravery, the citizens gave me a horse to help in my journey back. They saw how weary and battered I was and wanted to make sure I got here safely.
Gandalf nodded, amused.
Quite generous of them.
Analexius, realizing Valen was in the room, turned to face him with a theatrical gasp
Ah, Val! You left me alone in Classoria, fighting off the bugs and glitches! But it’s fine, really. I handled it all on my own. I guess I didn’t need your help after all.
He laughed, trying to keep up the bravado, but Valen’s knowing smirk made it clear he wasn’t fooled.
Sure, Analexius. Sounds like you had quite the adventure.
Analexius grinned sheepishly, knowing full well that his tale was far from the truth. But for now, he basked in the unexpected glory, even if it was a bit exaggerated.
